article:
An 'overseas department' ( or DOM) is a department of France that is outside
metropolitan France. They have the same political status as metropolitan
departments. As integral parts of France and the European Union, overseas
departments are represented in the National Assembly, Senate, and Economic and
Social Council, vote to elect European Parliament (MEP), and also use the Euro
as their currency. Each overseas department is also an overseas region.

As of March 2011, the overseas departments of France are the following:

* '[[French Guiana]]' in South America
* '[[Guadeloupe]]' in North America (the Caribbean)
* '[[Martinique]]' in North America (the Caribbean)
* '[[RÃ©union]]' in Africa (the Indian Ocean)
* '[[Mayotte]]' in Africa (the Indian Ocean)
categories: Overseas departments, collectivities and territories of France|
